conclusion: The question asks how the shadows A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves forward, above the objects.
A is the shadow of a hand-shaped object.
B is the shadow of a camera.
C is the shadow of a small, possibly metallic object.
D is the shadow of a peach.
The light source moves forward, above the objects, meaning it is moving closer to the objects and slightly above them.
As the light source moves forward, the shadow of the hand-shaped object will become shorter and wider.
The shadow of the camera will also become shorter and wider.
The shadow of the small metallic object will also become shorter and wider.
The shadow of the peach will also become shorter and wider.
When the light source moves forward, above the objects, the shadows A, B, C, and D will all become shorter and wider.
